info.title: Inform API
info.description: This document contains the technical overview of the available integration points of the Inform API. Inform ERP API’s are offered through a monthly subscription and fee-based professional services to assist the technical developer in understanding, developing, and troubleshooting integrations built using the Inform API. The Inform API uses JSON (JavaScript Object Notation)

post.description: Used to create a new “Point Of Sale” account in Inform.
Used to return high level A/R financials for an account.

Price and Stock uses the Inform price matrix to return real-time, customer-specific pricing, including quantity breaks. Stock information can be returned for all active warehouses, or only the default warehouse for the specified branch.  For a list of products use the itemList array. For Price / Stock you have 2 options that relate to price. If you use “accountNumber": "ECOMM" the price returned will be the guest “web price” assigned in Inform.  Usually, L1 guest pricing and not customer specific.  No token is required as the shopper has not logged in yet. If you use an "accountNumber" and a "userId" (the account number and user id returned in the validate user) along with the token, then you will get the specific pricing assigned to that account. The inventory amount returned is the same for either option.  If you are just doing inventory then simple web price approach will be faster.
Will create a new sales order

Before this can be used, the Inform customer must have this chargeable feature enabled. This is for the end-user to ‘pay’ their open invoices using a credit card.  This API uses Credit Card information provided by your credit card processing company and applies to invoices.  It is the user’s responsibility to ensure the invoice number being marked as paid is an open invoice.  DDI does not confirm payment, only records the results provided in the API.

Used to validate an email address against the contacts in Inform.  Response contains a session token, and information, requirements, permissions from the Inform Contact screen, and associated Customer/Ship To screens.  userName, password, and passphrase will be provided by DDI System.  These 3 fields in addition to the token will be used for subsequent API calls during the session.

isValid.description: Whether or not the request was successful

errorMessage.description: If the request was unsuccessful, the message indicating why

contactName.description: The email address of the contact record

isValid.description: \'yes\' if the username, password, passPhrase are valid

token.description: Token associated to the user/account for subsequent calls

branch.description: Default branch assigned to the account

user.description: Contains the array elements for each account the active user is on.  If the contactName (email) is not found on any active account the user element will be empty.

userId.description: Internal numeric key for this contact record. Needed for further requests

email.description: Email address on the contact record in Inform

viewOrderPad.description: If yes, the user can see the Inform Order Pad

payOnline.description: If yes, the user can pay invoices online

allowManualShipto.description: If yes, a manual ship to can be entered

viewSalesOrder.description: If yes, the user can view Sales Orders on "My Account" page

viewInvoice.description: If yes, the user can view Invoices on "My Account" page

accountNumber.description: The Inform customer number associated with this contact. Needed for further requests.

requirePO.description: Cust P/O \# Req field. If yes, a customer PO number is required when placing an order.

allowOnAccount.description: If no, user must pay online.  Based on Terms field

allowQuote.description: If yes, user can request quote from shopping card

allowOrderFromQuote.description: If yes, user can complete order from quote on "My Account" page

approveSalesOrder.description: If yes, user can enter order and/or approve order for others

orderPadOnly.description: If yes, user can only order item on the Order Pad

billPostCode.description: Customer Remit to Address, Zip Code

isValid.description: If the request was successful or not

token.description: Token returned from the Validate User call

userId.description: The contact number returned from the Validate User call

accountNumber.description: The account number returned from the Validate User call

branch.description: The branch number returned from the Validate User call

allWarehouse.description: Include stock for all warehouses, not just the warehouse associated to the branch number returned from the Validate User call

itemList.description: Array of product codes and quantity

stockNum.description: The product code you are checking price and stock for

isValid.description: Yes if the userId (email address) is found on Active accountNumber Contact record(s) and the token is valid for the session and the request parameters are valid.  No if none of the previous criteria are met.

accountNumber.description: Account Number used for requesting price and stock

branch.description: Default branch assigned to the account/user

itemData.description: Contains the array elements of the product code(s) you are checking price and stock for

lineItem.description: Contains information for each individual product code

stockNum.description: Product code returned based on requestNum

requestNum.description: This is the product code you requested

price.description: Price associated to unit of measure

locations.description: Contains the array elements for each warehouse

warehouse.description: The numeric code of the Warehouse

prices.description: Price object containing list and net price

x-ms-openai-manifest.modelDescription: Manages operations around orders, invoices, pricing, and stock availability
